page.title: 01NORTH KYME AND SURROUNDS
page.content: The area that{North Kyme C.P.School has been asked to survey contains the {village of North Kyme and parts of {Anwick and Ruskington Fens.}The area is basically used for farming,mainly arable with wheat, barley,potatoes,and sugar beet being grown. The land is called{Black Fenland}being peat silt.The{Witham peat fens}are the only place in Lincolnshire where this kind of land is found. One of the most important landmarks in the area is the{Car Dyke which was built by the Romans. This is said to have been used to drain the silt fens. The dyke actually runs from the Waterbeach in Cambridgeshire to the River Witham near Lincoln,a distance of 76 miles.Remains of a {Roman tumulus}have been found at the south end of the village of North Kyme.
